summary: The Colorectal Cancer Early Detection Act authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the CDC, to provide grants to states for increasing awareness, education, and early detection of colorectal cancer, especially in young individuals (under 45). The bill focuses on outreach, education, partnerships, and activities to improve early detection, including support for diagnostic testing, referrals, public awareness campaigns, and healthcare professional education. Grants are for 5 years and states must report on grant usage.
